# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that solves your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    result *= "\n" * line
    return result
end
```

Here is an example of how to use this function:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

In this example, the string is broken up into words and each word is added to a line until that line exceeds 10 characters in length. When it does, a new line is started with the current word. The function then continues adding words to lines until all words have been processed.
